interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Intouchables
Review Date: 2015/04/09
Store: François Cluzet  (Actor),     Omar Sy  (Actor),     Eric Toledano  (Director),     Olivier Nakache  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'When Driss, an ex-con from the projects, is hired to take care of an eccentric French aristocrat named Philippe, his newfound job quickly becomes an unpredictable adventure. Speeding a Maserati through Paris, seducing women and paragliding over the Alps is just the beginning, as Driss turns the often humorous world of upper-class Parisian society upside-down. As this unlikely duo overcome adversity of every flavor in this true story, they also shatter their preconceptions of love, life and each other. Based on the #1 international best-selling book, “You Changed My Life.”', 'Amazon.com', "Driss (Omar Sy), a Senegalese man living in a Paris slum, applies for a job as caretaker to a wealthy quadriplegic, but all he wants is to get his paper stamped so he can get benefits. Despite his lack of qualifications, he lands the job because of his attitude: Philippe (François Cluzet), the quadriplegic, wants a caretaker who will look at him without pity. As Driss reluctantly learns to move, feed, and clean Philippe, the two men discover a blunt but vital humor that not only bridges the cultural and class divide between them, but gives Philippe a renewed joy in life. It's easy to see what made", 'The Intouchables', "such a massive success in France; the movie has the sweet sincerity and uplifting conclusion that make for a classic feel-good experience. The chemistry between the two leads is undeniable, and Sy--who won the French equivalent of the Oscar for his role--is a dynamic and charismatic performer, while Cluzet's understated performance conveys Philippe's frustrations. The movie doesn't dig too deeply into the struggles of life as a quadriplegic or the struggles of life among the inner-city poor, so when", 'The Intouchables', "ends it's not likely to leave a lasting impression, but that doesn't get in the way of its immediate charm and warmth.", '--Bret Fetzer']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Omar Sy, François Cluzet, Cyril Mendy, Eric Toledano, Olivier Nakache, Anne Le Ny, Salimata Kamate, Joséphine de Meaux, Absa Diatou Toure, Dominique Daguier, Grégoire Oestermann, Audrey Fleurot, Clotilde Mollet, Alba Gaïa Kraghede BellugiOmar Sy, François Cluzet, Cyril Mendy, Eric Toledano, Olivier Nakache, Anne Le Ny, Salimata Kamate, Joséphine de Meaux, Absa Diatou Toure, Dominique Daguier, Grégoire Oestermann, Audrey Fleurot, Clotilde Mollet, Alba Gaïa Kraghede Bellugi  See more', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 52 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2017', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26256632', 'Director': 'Eric Toledano, Olivier Nakache', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 52 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 5, 2013', 'Actors': 'François Cluzet, Omar Sy, Anne Le Ny, Audrey Fleurot, Joséphine de Meaux', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: One of the absolutly best movies that I have ever seen.  Could have watched  Omar Sy dance for hours and hours  When I think that my like is difficult, all I have to do is watch a few minutes of this movie to feel truly blessed.
Review Title: Wonderful, wonderful movie
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'When Driss, an ex-con from the projects, is hired to take care of an eccentric French aristocrat named Philippe, his newfound job quickly becomes an unpredictable adventure. Speeding a Maserati through Paris, seducing women and paragliding over the Alps is just the beginning, as Driss turns the often humorous world of upper-class Parisian society upside-down. As this unlikely duo overcome adversity of every flavor in this true story, they also shatter their preconceptions of love, life and each other. Based on the #1 international best-selling book, “You Changed My Life.”', 'Amazon.com', "Driss (Omar Sy), a Senegalese man living in a Paris slum, applies for a job as caretaker to a wealthy quadriplegic, but all he wants is to get his paper stamped so he can get benefits. Despite his lack of qualifications, he lands the job because of his attitude: Philippe (François Cluzet), the quadriplegic, wants a caretaker who will look at him without pity. As Driss reluctantly learns to move, feed, and clean Philippe, the two men discover a blunt but vital humor that not only bridges the cultural and class divide between them, but gives Philippe a renewed joy in life. It's easy to see what made", 'The Intouchables', "such a massive success in France; the movie has the sweet sincerity and uplifting conclusion that make for a classic feel-good experience. The chemistry between the two leads is undeniable, and Sy--who won the French equivalent of the Oscar for his role--is a dynamic and charismatic performer, while Cluzet's understated performance conveys Philippe's frustrations. The movie doesn't dig too deeply into the struggles of life as a quadriplegic or the struggles of life among the inner-city poor, so when", 'The Intouchables', "ends it's not likely to leave a lasting impression, but that doesn't get in the way of its immediate charm and warmth.", '--Bret Fetzer']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

The user demonstrates a strong affinity for heartfelt and uplifting films, particularly those that blend drama and comedy. They appreciate movies that highlight deep emotional connections and the transformative power of friendship, as evidenced by their enthusiastic review of a specific film featuring strong lead performances. The user values narratives that challenge social norms and cultural divides, indicating a preference for stories that explore personal growth and resilience.

Key trends include:
- **Genre Preference:** Drama and comedy, especially feel-good narratives.
- **Emotional Resonance:** Enjoyment of films that offer a sense of warmth, charm, and humor amidst adversity.
- **Performance Appreciation:** A strong appreciation for dynamic lead performances, particularly noteworthy actors.
- **Personal Impact:** The user looks for films that provide perspective on life challenges and evoke a sense of gratitude.

Overall, the user finds joy in cinematic experiences that not only entertain but also inspire personal reflection and a renewed appreciation for life.
